summary:
The 2020 Summer Olympics, held in Tokyo, Japan, were unique due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Originally planned for 2020, they were postponed to 2021, the first time in history. With no spectators allowed, the Games featured new sports like 3x3 basketball and skateboarding. 

The United States won the most gold and total medals. Japan, the host nation, achieved its best performance, while Bermuda, the Philippines, and Qatar won their first-ever gold medals. The Games were also notable for being the most expensive, with costs exceeding $20 billion.
title: 2020 Summer Olympics
